intro: Leontopodium lingianum, commonly known as the lingua edelweiss, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its flowers typically bloom in late summer, and the plant is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. Due to its habitat and appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in alpine gardens.
